snippet: To Californians, it was all a little baffling. Why would Senator John McCain pull out of the only Republican debate scheduled in the nation's most-populous state the week before the highest-stakes primary on the calendar?    ''I can't fathom it fo...
lead_paragraph: To Californians, it was all a little baffling. Why would Senator John McCain pull out of the only Republican debate scheduled in the nation's most-populous state the week before the highest-stakes primary on the calendar? ''I can't fathom it for a moment,'' said Zev Yaroslavsky, a Democrat on the Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors. ''It's been promoted quite a bit already, and to me, even though it's in California, it's a national debate. McCain must feel he has a darned good reason for pulling out of what is the last debate before Super Tuesday. But I don't get it.''
abstract: Republican presidential candidate Sen John McCain pulls out of only Republican debate scheduled in California next week before highest-stakes primary, baffling and catching everyone by surprise and causing dissension in his campaign (M)

headline.main: McCain Putting Bush-Leaning California in Rearview Mirror
